title: Top-secret World War II bunker hits the market in Victoria, near the Murray River
text:
A top-secret World War II bunker has hit the market as a unique four-bedroom underground home.

The Royal Australian Air Force built the 8mm-thick steel bunker into the side of a hill and covered it with dirt in 1941, to keep it hidden from the Japanese.

It was used to store fuel for the nearby Mildura base, alongside the Murray River, in Victoria.

The Royal Australian Air Force built the 8mm-thick steel bunker into the side of a hill and covered it with dirt in 1941

The former WWII bunker also has a modern kitchen with gas cooking and a dishwasher

Stephen Gooding purchased four bunkers 30 years ago and renovated them into homes for himself and his family.

'They were top secret back in those days — there was barbed wire everywhere,' he told realestate.com.au.

'They closed them up in 1945, after the war, and then they were privatised. I bought four of them 30 years ago.'

Mr Gooding currently lives in the bunker which he converted into a 'six-bedroom underground house' for himself and his wife, while he sold off the other two.

Along with his son Zachary, the pair listed the fourth house which is on 5000sqm, for sale last week.

All four bedrooms in the newly renovated bunker boast a ceiling fan (pictured)

There is more room upstairs and the new homeowner can do whatever they want with the property

He renovated the former fuel bunker into a four bedroom home - each room with a ceiling fan.

The home also boasts a modern kitchen with gas cooking and a dishwasher, an open-plan living and dining area, and two bathrooms.

Temperatures in the bunker hover at 20C - meaning cheap electricity bills when it comes to heating and cooling.

There is more room upstairs and the new homeowner can do whatever they want with the property.

The house will go under the hammer on November 16.
description: The Royal Australian Air Force built the bunker to store fuel during World War II.
authors: Sahar Mourad For Daily Mail Australia
